revised_title: The Deposition of Barium Sulphate as a Cementing Material in Sandstone
tldr: The author investigates the unique sandstone found in Bramcote and Stapleford, which contains a high percentage of crystalline barium sulphate. The high specific gravity of the sandstone is due to the barium sulphate acting as a binding or cementing material. The author explores the possible ways in which the barium sulphate might have been deposited, including the influence of local geological and chemical factors.
